V Berlinu obeležujejo 30. obletnico padca zidu
04 Nov 2019, 13:05 by STA

V nemški prestolnici se danes začenjajo uradne slovesnosti ob 30. obletnici padca Berlinskega zidu, ki bodo potekale cel teden. V petek se bo v Berlinu z namenom obeležitve obletnice mudil tudi slovenski predsednik Borut Pahor, ki se bo sestal z nemškim gostiteljem Frank-Walterjem Steinmeierjem.



Osrednja proslava bo 9. novembra pred Brandenburškimi vrati, kjer so pred 30 leti Berlinčani na zgodovinski večer splezali in se veselili na betonskem zidu, ki je 28 let ločeval mesto in državo. Foto: pixabay.com

BERLIN > Pod geslom 30 let mirne revolucije in padca zidu se bo v Berlinu med 4. in 10. novembrom zvrstilo skoraj 200 dogodkov, med njimi koncerti, predavanja in razstave na sedmih zgodovinskih krajih. Praznovanja bodo vrhunec doživela 9. novembra, ko bodo Berlinčani podoživeli noč, v kateri je padel zid.
Enotedenski festival na prostem bo danes uradno začel župan Michael Müller na Alexanderplatzu, kjer je 4. novembra 1989 reforme in svobodne volitve zahtevalo več sto tisoč vzhodnih Nemcev - po nekaterih ocenah jih je bilo celo milijon. Sledil je odstop celotnega vodstva tedanje Nemške demokratične republike (NDR) ter 9. novembra padec zidu, ki je bil simbol delitve med Vzhodom in Zahodom.
Osrednja proslava bo 9. novembra pred Brandenburškimi vrati, kjer so pred 30 leti Berlinčani na zgodovinski večer splezali in se veselili na betonskem zidu, ki je 28 let ločeval mesto in državo.
Pred Brandenburškimi vrati bosta na osrednjem dogodku zbrane predvidoma nagovorila nemški predsednik Frank-Walter Steinmeier in kanclerka Angela Merkel. Osrednje slovesnosti se bodo udeležili tudi predsedniki iz višegrajske četverice (Češka, Poljska, Slovaška in Madžarska), Steinmeier pa naj bi se jim zahvalil za prispevek k mirni revoluciji v tedanji NDR.
Slovenski predsednik Borut Pahor se bo v Berlinu mudil dan prej. S Steinmeierjem se bo v petek sestal na delovnem zajtrku. Kot napovedujejo v predsednikovem uradu, se bosta pogovarjala o dvostranskem sodelovanju in aktualnih evropskih in globalnih temah.
Slovenski predsednik bo ob 30. obletnici padca Berlinskega zidu tudi položil venec na obeležje zidu in žrtvam zidu na Berghaus Strasse v Berlinu. Na povabilo ICD - Mednarodnega centra za kulturno diplomacijo se bo udeležil tudi konference ob 30. obletnici padca Berlinskega zidu, kjer bo udeležencem predstavil svoj pogled na pomen dogodkov pred 30. leti v Evropi in kaj ti pomenijo za skupno evropsko prihodnost, še napovedujejo v Pahorjevem uradu.

Berlin marks the 30th anniversary of the fall of the wall
04 Nov 2019, 13:05 by STA

Official ceremonies for the 30th anniversary of the fall of the Berlin Wall begin today in the German capital, which will take place all week. On Friday, Slovene President Borut Pahor will also meet in Berlin to meet with German host Frank-Walter Steinmeier.



The central celebration will be on November 9th in front of the Brandenburg Gate, where 30 years ago the Berliners climbed and cheered on a concrete wall that separated the city and country for 28 years. Photo credit: pixabay.com

BERLIN> Under the motto of 30 Years of Peaceful Revolution and the Fall of the Wall, nearly 200 events will take place in Berlin between November 4 and 10, including concerts, lectures and exhibitions at seven historic sites. The celebrations will culminate on November 9, when the Berliners relive the night the wall fell.
The one-week outdoor festival will be officially launched today by Mayor Michael Müller at Alexanderplatz, where hundreds of thousands of East Germans demanded reforms and free elections on November 4, 1989 - estimated to be as many as a million. This was followed by the resignation of the entire leadership of the then German Democratic Republic (NDR) and the fall of the wall on November 9, which was a symbol of the division between East and West.
The central celebration will be on November 9th in front of the Brandenburg Gate, where 30 years ago the Berliners climbed and cheered on a concrete wall that separated the city and country for 28 years.
German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier and Chancellor Angela Merkel are expected to address the gathering in front of the Brandenburg Gate. Presidents from the Visegrad Quartet (Czech Republic, Poland, Slovakia and Hungary) will also attend the keynote ceremony, and Steinmeier thanked them for their contribution to the peaceful revolution in the then GDR.
Slovenian President Borut Pahor will leave for Berlin the day before. He will meet with Steinmeier on Friday for a work breakfast. According to the President's Office, they will discuss bilateral cooperation and current European and global topics.
On the 30th anniversary of the fall of the Berlin Wall, the Slovenian president will also lay a wreath on the wall and the victims at the Berghaus Strasse in Berlin. At the invitation of the ICD - International Center for Cultural Diplomacy, he will also attend a conference marking the 30th anniversary of the fall of the Berlin Wall, where he will present his views on the significance of the events of 30 years ago in Europe and what they mean for the common European future, Pahor announced.
